1300    @classmethod
1301    def extract_border_pts(cls, field, axis, front_side, field_dim=1, offset=0):
1302        npa = field.ndim - field_dim
1303        base_face = np.hstack((np.arange(axis + 1, npa), np.arange(axis)))
1304        if not front_side:
1305            base_face = base_face[::-1]
1306        border_field = field.transpose(
1307            axis + field_dim, *np.arange(field_dim), *(base_face + field_dim)
1308        )[(-(1 + offset) if front_side else offset)]
1309        return border_field
1310
1311    @classmethod
1312    def extract_border_spline(cls, spline, axis, front_side):
1313        base_face = np.hstack((np.arange(axis + 1, spline.NPa), np.arange(axis)))
1314        if not front_side:
1315            base_face = base_face[::-1]
1316        degrees = spline.getDegrees()
1317        knots = spline.getKnots()
1318        border_degrees = [degrees[i] for i in base_face]
1319        border_knots = [knots[i] for i in base_face]
1320        border_spline = BSpline(border_degrees, border_knots)
1321        return border_spline
1322
1323    @classmethod
1324    def transpose_and_flip(cls, field, transpose, flip, field_dim=1):
1325        field = field.transpose(*np.arange(field_dim), *(transpose + field_dim))
1326        for i in range(flip.size):
1327            if flip[i]:
1328                field = np.flip(field, axis=(i + field_dim))
1329        return field
1330
1331    @classmethod
1332    def transpose_and_flip_knots(cls, knots, spans, transpose, flip):
1333        new_knots = []
1334        for i in range(flip.size):
1335            if flip[i]:
1336                new_knots.append(sum(spans[i]) - knots[transpose[i]][::-1])
1337            else:
1338                new_knots.append(knots[transpose[i]])
1339        return new_knots
1340
1341    @classmethod
1342    def transpose_and_flip_back_knots(cls, knots, spans, transpose, flip):
1343        transpose_back = np.argsort(transpose)
1344        flip_back = flip[transpose_back]
1345        return cls.transpose_and_flip_knots(knots, spans, transpose_back, flip_back)
1346
1347    @classmethod
1348    def transpose_and_flip_spline(cls, spline, transpose, flip):
1349        spans = spline.getSpans()
1350        knots = spline.getKnots()
1351        degrees = spline.getDegrees()
1352        for i in range(flip.size):
1353            p = degrees[transpose[i]]
1354            knot = knots[transpose[i]]
1355            if flip[i]:
1356                knot = sum(spans[i]) - knot[::-1]
1357            spline.bases[i] = BSplineBasis(p, knot)
1358        return spline
1359
1360    @classmethod
1361    def from_splines(cls, separated_ctrl_pts, splines):
1362        NPa = splines[0].NPa
1363        assert np.all(
1364            [sp.NPa == NPa for sp in splines]
1365        ), "Every patch should have the same parametric space dimension !"
1366        NPh = separated_ctrl_pts[0].shape[0]
1367        assert np.all(
1368            [ctrl_pts.shape[0] == NPh for ctrl_pts in separated_ctrl_pts]
1369        ), "Every patch should have the same physical space dimension !"
1370        npatch = len(splines)
1371        all_flip = np.unpackbits(
1372            np.arange(2 ** (NPa - 1), dtype="uint8")[:, None],
1373            axis=1,
1374            count=(NPa - 1 - 8),
1375            bitorder="little",
1376        )[:, ::-1].astype("bool")
1377        all_transpose = np.array(list(permutations(np.arange(NPa - 1))))
1378        spline1_inds = []
1379        spline2_inds = []
1380        axes1 = []
1381        axes2 = []
1382        front_sides1 = []
1383        front_sides2 = []
1384        transpose_2_to_1 = []
1385        flip_2_to_1 = []
1386        for spline1_ind in range(npatch):
1387            spline1 = splines[spline1_ind]
1388            ctrl_pts1 = separated_ctrl_pts[spline1_ind]
1389            # print(f"sp1 {spline1_ind}")
1390            for spline2_ind in range(spline1_ind + 1, npatch):
1391                spline2 = splines[spline2_ind]
1392                ctrl_pts2 = separated_ctrl_pts[spline2_ind]
1393                # print(f"|sp2 {spline2_ind}")
1394                for axis1 in range(spline1.NPa):
1395                    degrees1 = np.hstack(
1396                        (
1397                            spline1.getDegrees()[(axis1 + 1) :],
1398                            spline1.getDegrees()[:axis1],
1399                        )
1400                    )
1401                    knots1 = (
1402                        spline1.getKnots()[(axis1 + 1) :] + spline1.getKnots()[:axis1]
1403                    )
1404                    # print(f"||ax1 {axis1}")
1405                    for axis2 in range(spline2.NPa):
1406                        degrees2 = np.hstack(
1407                            (
1408                                spline2.getDegrees()[(axis2 + 1) :],
1409                                spline2.getDegrees()[:axis2],
1410                            )
1411                        )
1412                        knots2 = (
1413                            spline2.getKnots()[(axis2 + 1) :]
1414                            + spline2.getKnots()[:axis2]
1415                        )
1416                        spans2 = (
1417                            spline2.getSpans()[(axis2 + 1) :]
1418                            + spline2.getSpans()[:axis2]
1419                        )
1420                        # print(f"|||ax2 {axis2}")
1421                        for front_side1 in [False, True]:
1422                            pts1 = cls.extract_border_pts(ctrl_pts1, axis1, front_side1)
1423                            # print(f"||||{'front' if front_side1 else 'back '} side1")
1424                            for front_side2 in [False, True]:
1425                                pts2 = cls.extract_border_pts(
1426                                    ctrl_pts2, axis2, front_side2
1427                                )
1428                                # print(f"|||||{'front' if front_side2 else 'back '} side2")
1429                                for transpose in all_transpose:
1430                                    # print(f"||||||transpose {transpose}")
1431                                    if (
1432                                        degrees1 == [degrees2[i] for i in transpose]
1433                                    ).all():
1434                                        # print(f"||||||same degrees {degrees1}")
1435                                        if list(pts1.shape[1:]) == [
1436                                            pts2.shape[1:][i] for i in transpose
1437                                        ]:
1438                                            # print(f"||||||same shapes {pts1.shape[1:]}")
1439                                            if np.all(
1440                                                [
1441                                                    knots1[i].size
1442                                                    == knots2[transpose[i]].size
1443                                                    for i in range(NPa - 1)
1444                                                ]
1445                                            ):
1446                                                # print(f"||||||same knots sizes {[knots1[i].size for i in range(NPa - 1)]}")
1447                                                for flip in all_flip:
1448                                                    # print(f"|||||||flip {flip}")
1449                                                    if np.all(
1450                                                        [
1451                                                            (k1 == k2).all()
1452                                                            for k1, k2 in zip(
1453                                                                knots1,
1454                                                                cls.transpose_and_flip_knots(
1455                                                                    knots2,
1456                                                                    spans2,
1457                                                                    transpose,
1458                                                                    flip,
1459                                                                ),
1460                                                            )
1461                                                        ]
1462                                                    ):
1463                                                        # print(f"|||||||same knots {knots1}")
1464                                                        pts2_turned = (
1465                                                            cls.transpose_and_flip(
1466                                                                pts2, transpose, flip
1467                                                            )
1468                                                        )
1469                                                        if np.allclose(
1470                                                            pts1, pts2_turned
1471                                                        ):
1472                                                            # print("_________________GOGOGO_________________")
1473                                                            spline1_inds.append(
1474                                                                spline1_ind
1475                                                            )
1476                                                            spline2_inds.append(
1477                                                                spline2_ind
1478                                                            )
1479                                                            axes1.append(axis1)
1480                                                            axes2.append(axis2)
1481                                                            front_sides1.append(
1482                                                                front_side1
1483                                                            )
1484                                                            front_sides2.append(
1485                                                                front_side2
1486                                                            )
1487                                                            transpose_2_to_1.append(
1488                                                                transpose
1489                                                            )
1490                                                            flip_2_to_1.append(flip)
1491        spline1_inds = np.array(spline1_inds, dtype="int")
1492        spline2_inds = np.array(spline2_inds, dtype="int")
1493        axes1 = np.array(axes1, dtype="int")
1494        axes2 = np.array(axes2, dtype="int")
1495        front_sides1 = np.array(front_sides1, dtype="bool")
1496        front_sides2 = np.array(front_sides2, dtype="bool")
1497        transpose_2_to_1 = np.array(transpose_2_to_1, dtype="int")
1498        flip_2_to_1 = np.array(flip_2_to_1, dtype="bool")
1499        return cls(
1500            spline1_inds,
1501            spline2_inds,
1502            axes1,
1503            axes2,
1504            front_sides1,
1505            front_sides2,
1506            transpose_2_to_1,
1507            flip_2_to_1,
1508            NPa,
1509        )
1510
1511    def append(self, other):
1512        if self.NPa != other.NPa:
1513            raise ValueError(
1514                f"operands could not be concatenated with parametric spaces of dimensions {self.NPa} and {other.NPa}"
1515            )
1516        self.spline1_inds = np.concatenate(
1517            (self.spline1_inds, other.spline1_inds), axis=0
1518        )
1519        self.spline2_inds = np.concatenate(
1520            (self.spline2_inds, other.spline2_inds), axis=0
1521        )
1522        self.axes1 = np.concatenate((self.axes1, other.axes1), axis=0)
1523        self.axes2 = np.concatenate((self.axes2, other.axes2), axis=0)
1524        self.front_sides1 = np.concatenate(
1525            (self.front_sides1, other.front_sides1), axis=0
1526        )
1527        self.front_sides2 = np.concatenate(
1528            (self.front_sides2, other.front_sides2), axis=0
1529        )
1530        self.transpose_2_to_1 = np.concatenate(
1531            (self.transpose_2_to_1, other.transpose_2_to_1), axis=0
1532        )
1533        self.flip_2_to_1 = np.concatenate((self.flip_2_to_1, other.flip_2_to_1), axis=0)
1534        self.nb_couples += other.nb_couples
1535
1536    def get_operator_allxi1_to_allxi2(self, spans1, spans2, couple_ind):
1537        ax1 = self.axes1[couple_ind]
1538        ax2 = self.axes2[couple_ind]
1539        front1 = self.front_sides1[couple_ind]
1540        front2 = self.front_sides2[couple_ind]
1541        transpose = self.transpose_2_to_1[couple_ind]
1542        flip = self.flip_2_to_1[couple_ind]
1543
1544        A = np.zeros((self.NPa, self.NPa), dtype="float")
1545        A[ax2, ax1] = -1 if front1 == front2 else 1
1546        arr = np.arange(self.NPa)
1547        j1 = np.hstack((arr[(ax1 + 1) :], arr[:ax1]))
1548        j2 = np.hstack((arr[(ax2 + 1) :], arr[:ax2]))
1549        A[j2[transpose], j1] = [-1 if f else 1 for f in flip]
1550        b = np.zeros(self.NPa, dtype="float")
1551        b[ax2] = (int(front1) + int(front2)) * (1 if front2 else -1)
1552        b[j2[transpose]] = [1 if f else 0 for f in flip]
1553
1554        alpha1, beta1 = np.array(spans1).T
1555        M1, p1 = np.diag(1 / (beta1 - alpha1)), -alpha1 / (beta1 - alpha1)
1556        alpha2, beta2 = np.array(spans2).T
1557        M2, p2 = np.diag(beta2 - alpha2), alpha2
1558        b = p2 + M2 @ b + M2 @ A @ p1
1559        A = M2 @ A @ M1
1560
1561        return A, b
1562
1563    def get_connectivity(self, shape_by_patch):
1564        indices = []
1565        start = 0
1566        for shape in shape_by_patch:
1567            end = start + np.prod(shape)
1568            indices.append(np.arange(start, end).reshape(shape))
1569            start = end
1570        nodes_couples = []
1571        for i in range(self.nb_couples):
1572            border_inds1 = self.__class__.extract_border_pts(
1573                indices[self.spline1_inds[i]],
1574                self.axes1[i],
1575                self.front_sides1[i],
1576                field_dim=0,
1577            )
1578            border_inds2 = self.__class__.extract_border_pts(
1579                indices[self.spline2_inds[i]],
1580                self.axes2[i],
1581                self.front_sides2[i],
1582                field_dim=0,
1583            )
1584            border_inds2_turned_and_fliped = self.__class__.transpose_and_flip(
1585                border_inds2, self.transpose_2_to_1[i], self.flip_2_to_1[i], field_dim=0
1586            )
1587            nodes_couples.append(
1588                np.hstack(
1589                    (
1590                        border_inds1.reshape((-1, 1)),
1591                        border_inds2_turned_and_fliped.reshape((-1, 1)),
1592                    )
1593                )
1594            )
1595        if len(nodes_couples) > 0:
1596            nodes_couples = np.vstack(nodes_couples)
1597        return MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity.from_nodes_couples(
1598            nodes_couples, shape_by_patch
1599        )
1600
1601    def get_borders_couples(self, separated_field, offset=0):
1602        field_dim = separated_field[0].ndim - self.NPa
1603        borders1 = []
1604        borders2_turned_and_fliped = []
1605        for i in range(self.nb_couples):
1606            border1 = self.__class__.extract_border_pts(
1607                separated_field[self.spline1_inds[i]],
1608                self.axes1[i],
1609                self.front_sides1[i],
1610                offset=offset,
1611                field_dim=field_dim,
1612            )
1613            borders1.append(border1)
1614            border2 = self.__class__.extract_border_pts(
1615                separated_field[self.spline2_inds[i]],
1616                self.axes2[i],
1617                self.front_sides2[i],
1618                offset=offset,
1619                field_dim=field_dim,
1620            )
1621            border2_turned_and_fliped = self.__class__.transpose_and_flip(
1622                border2,
1623                self.transpose_2_to_1[i],
1624                self.flip_2_to_1[i],
1625                field_dim=field_dim,
1626            )
1627            borders2_turned_and_fliped.append(border2_turned_and_fliped)
1628        return borders1, borders2_turned_and_fliped
1629
1630    def get_borders_couples_splines(self, splines):
1631        borders1 = []
1632        borders2_turned_and_fliped = []
1633        for i in range(self.nb_couples):
1634            border1 = self.__class__.extract_border_spline(
1635                splines[self.spline1_inds[i]], self.axes1[i], self.front_sides1[i]
1636            )
1637            borders1.append(border1)
1638            border2 = self.__class__.extract_border_spline(
1639                splines[self.spline2_inds[i]], self.axes2[i], self.front_sides2[i]
1640            )
1641            border2_turned_and_fliped = self.__class__.transpose_and_flip_spline(
1642                border2, self.transpose_2_to_1[i], self.flip_2_to_1[i]
1643            )
1644            borders2_turned_and_fliped.append(border2_turned_and_fliped)
1645        return borders1, borders2_turned_and_fliped
1646
1647    def compute_border_couple_DN(
1648        self,
1649        couple_ind: int,
1650        splines: list[BSpline],
1651        XI1_border: list[np.ndarray],
1652        k1: list[int],
1653    ):
1654        spline1 = splines[self.spline1_inds[couple_ind]]
1655        ax1 = self.axes1[couple_ind]
1656        front1 = self.front_sides1[couple_ind]
1657        spline2 = splines[self.spline2_inds[couple_ind]]
1658        ax2 = self.axes2[couple_ind]
1659        front2 = self.front_sides2[couple_ind]
1660        XI1 = (
1661            XI1_border[(self.NPa - 1 - ax1) :]
1662            + [np.array([spline1.bases[ax1].span[int(front1)]])]
1663            + XI1_border[: (self.NPa - 1 - ax1)]
1664        )
1665        transpose_back = np.argsort(self.transpose_2_to_1[couple_ind])
1666        flip_back = self.flip_2_to_1[couple_ind][transpose_back]
1667        spans = spline2.getSpans()[(ax2 + 1) :] + spline2.getSpans()[:ax2]
1668        XI2_border = [
1669            (
1670                (sum(spans[i]) - XI1_border[transpose_back[i]])
1671                if flip_back[i]
1672                else XI1_border[transpose_back[i]]
1673            )
1674            for i in range(self.NPa - 1)
1675        ]
1676        XI2 = (
1677            XI2_border[(self.NPa - 1 - ax2) :]
1678            + [np.array([spline2.bases[ax2].span[int(front2)]])]
1679            + XI2_border[: (self.NPa - 1 - ax2)]
1680        )
1681        k2 = k1[: self.axes1[couple_ind]] + k1[(self.axes1[couple_ind] + 1) :]
1682        k2 = [k2[i] for i in transpose_back]
1683        k2 = (
1684            k2[: self.axes2[couple_ind]]
1685            + [k1[self.axes1[couple_ind]]]
1686            + k2[self.axes2[couple_ind] :]
1687        )
1688        DN1 = spline1.DN(XI1, k=k1)
1689        DN2 = spline2.DN(XI2, k=k2)
1690        return DN1, DN2
1691
1692    def compute_border_couple_DN(
1693        self,
1694        couple_ind: int,
1695        splines: list[BSpline],
1696        XI1_border: list[np.ndarray],
1697        k1: list[int],
1698    ):
1699        spline1 = splines[self.spline1_inds[couple_ind]]
1700        spans1 = spline1.getSpans()
1701        ax1 = self.axes1[couple_ind]
1702        front1 = self.front_sides1[couple_ind]
1703        XI1 = (
1704            XI1_border[(self.NPa - 1 - ax1) :]
1705            + [np.array([spline1.bases[ax1].span[int(front1)]])]
1706            + XI1_border[: (self.NPa - 1 - ax1)]
1707        )
1708        DN1 = spline1.DN(XI1, k=k1)
1709
1710        spline2 = splines[self.spline2_inds[couple_ind]]
1711        spans2 = spline2.getSpans()
1712        ax2 = self.axes2[couple_ind]
1713        front2 = self.front_sides2[couple_ind]
1714        transpose = self.transpose_2_to_1[couple_ind]
1715        A, b = self.get_operator_allxi1_to_allxi2(spans1, spans2, couple_ind)
1716        XI2 = []
1717        for i in range(self.NPa):
1718            j = np.argmax(np.abs(A[i]))
1719            XI2.append(A[i, j] * XI1[j] + b[i])
1720
1721        k = int(sum(k1))
1722        DN2 = spline2.DN(XI2, k=k)
1723        if k != 0:
1724            AT = 1
1725            for i in range(k):
1726                AT = np.tensordot(AT, A, 0)
1727            AT = AT.transpose(*2 * np.arange(k), *(2 * np.arange(k) + 1))
1728            DN2 = np.tensordot(DN2, AT, k)
1729            i1 = np.repeat(np.arange(self.NPa), k1)
1730            DN2 = DN2[tuple(i1.tolist())]
1731        return DN1, DN2
class MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity: 
  54class MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity:
  55    """
  56    Contains all the methods to link multiple B-spline patches.
  57    It uses 3 representations of the data :
  58      - a unique representation, possibly common with other meshes, containing
  59        only unique nodes indices,
  60      - a unpacked representation containing duplicated nodes indices,
  61      - a separated representation containing duplicated nodes indices,
  62        separated between patches. It is here for user friendliness.
  63
  64    Attributes
  65    ----------
  66    unique_nodes_inds : np.ndarray[np.integer]
  67        The indices of the unique representation needed to create the unpacked one.
  68    shape_by_patch : np.ndarray[np.integer]
  69        The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
  70    nb_nodes : int
  71        The total number of unpacked nodes.
  72    nb_unique_nodes : int
  73        The total number of unique nodes.
  74    nb_patchs : int
  75        The number of patches.
  76    npa : int
  77        The dimension of the parametric space of the B-splines.
  78    """
  79
  80    unique_nodes_inds: np.ndarray
  81    shape_by_patch: np.ndarray
  82    nb_nodes: int
  83    nb_unique_nodes: int
  84    nb_patchs: int
  85    npa: int
  86
  87    def __init__(self, unique_nodes_inds, shape_by_patch, nb_unique_nodes):
  88        """
  89
  90        Parameters
  91        ----------
  92        unique_nodes_inds : np.ndarray[np.integer]
  93            The indices of the unique representation needed to create the unpacked one.
  94        shape_by_patch : np.ndarray[np.integer]
  95            The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
  96        nb_unique_nodes : int
  97            The total number of unique nodes.
  98        """
  99        self.unique_nodes_inds = unique_nodes_inds
 100        self.shape_by_patch = shape_by_patch
 101        self.nb_nodes = np.sum(np.prod(self.shape_by_patch, axis=1))
 102        self.nb_unique_nodes = nb_unique_nodes  # np.unique(self.unique_nodes_inds).size
 103        self.nb_patchs, self.npa = self.shape_by_patch.shape
 104
 105    @classmethod
 106    def from_nodes_couples(cls, nodes_couples, shape_by_patch):
 107        """
 108        Create the connectivity from a list of couples of unpacked nodes.
 109
 110        Parameters
 111        ----------
 112        nodes_couples : np.ndarray[np.integer]
 113            Couples of indices of unpacked nodes that are considered the same.
 114            Its shape should be (# of couples, 2)
 115        shape_by_patch : np.ndarray[np.integer]
 116            The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
 117
 118        Returns
 119        -------
 120        MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
 121            Instance of `MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity` created.
 122        """
 123        nb_nodes = np.sum(np.prod(shape_by_patch, axis=1))
 124        unique_nodes_inds = _get_unique_nodes_inds(
 125            nodes_couples.astype(np.int32), np.int64(nb_nodes)
 126        )
 127        different_unique_nodes_inds, inverse = np.unique(
 128            unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True
 129        )
 130        unique_nodes_inds -= np.cumsum(
 131            np.diff(np.concatenate(([-1], different_unique_nodes_inds))) - 1
 132        )[inverse]
 133        nb_unique_nodes = np.unique(unique_nodes_inds).size
 134        return cls(unique_nodes_inds, shape_by_patch, nb_unique_nodes)
 135
 136    @classmethod
 137    def from_separated_ctrlPts(
 138        cls, separated_ctrlPts, eps=1e-10, return_nodes_couples: bool = False
 139    ):
 140        """
 141        Create the connectivity from a list of control points given as
 142        a separated field by comparing every couple of points.
 143
 144        Parameters
 145        ----------
 146        separated_ctrlPts : list of np.ndarray[np.floating]
 147            Control points of every patch to be compared in the separated
 148            representation. Every array is of shape :
 149            (``NPh``, nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim ``npa``)
 150        eps : float, optional
 151            Maximum distance between two points to be considered the same, by default 1e-10
 152        return_nodes_couples : bool, optional
 153            If `True`, returns the `nodes_couples` created, by default False
 154
 155        Returns
 156        -------
 157        MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
 158            Instance of `MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity` created.
 159        """
 160        NPh = separated_ctrlPts[0].shape[0]
 161        assert np.all(
 162            [ctrlPts.shape[0] == NPh for ctrlPts in separated_ctrlPts[1:]]
 163        ), "Physical spaces must contain the same number of dimensions !"
 164        shape_by_patch = np.array(
 165            [ctrlPts.shape[1:] for ctrlPts in separated_ctrlPts], dtype="int"
 166        )
 167
 168        ctrlPts = np.hstack([pts.reshape((NPh, -1)) for pts in separated_ctrlPts])
 169        tree = cKDTree(ctrlPts.T)
 170        matches = tree.query_ball_tree(tree, r=eps)
 171        connex = set()
 172        for match in matches:
 173            if len(match) > 1:
 174                connex.add(tuple(sorted(match)))
 175        nodes_couples = []
 176        for tup in connex:
 177            tup = np.array(tup)
 178            nodes_couples.append(np.stack((tup[:-1], tup[1:])).T)
 179
 180        # nodes_couples = []
 181        # previous_pts = separated_ctrlPts[0].reshape((NPh, -1))
 182        # previous_inds_counter = previous_pts.shape[1]
 183        # previous_inds = np.arange(previous_inds_counter)
 184        # for ctrlPts in separated_ctrlPts[1:]:
 185        #     # create current pts and inds
 186        #     current_pts = ctrlPts.reshape((NPh, -1))
 187        #     current_inds_counter = previous_inds_counter + current_pts.shape[1]
 188        #     current_inds = np.arange(previous_inds_counter, current_inds_counter)
 189        #     # get couples
 190        #     dist = np.linalg.norm(
 191        #         previous_pts[:, :, None] - current_pts[:, None, :], axis=0
 192        #     )
 193        #     previous_inds_inds, current_inds_inds = (dist < eps).nonzero()
 194        #     nodes_couples.append(
 195        #         np.hstack(
 196        #             (
 197        #                 previous_inds[previous_inds_inds, None],
 198        #                 current_inds[current_inds_inds, None],
 199        #             )
 200        #         )
 201        #     )
 202        #     # add current to previous for next iteration
 203        #     previous_pts = np.hstack((previous_pts, current_pts))
 204        #     previous_inds_counter = current_inds_counter
 205        #     previous_inds = np.hstack((previous_inds, current_inds))
 206        if len(nodes_couples) > 0:
 207            nodes_couples = np.vstack(nodes_couples)
 208        else:
 209            nodes_couples = np.empty((0, 2), dtype="int")
 210        if return_nodes_couples:
 211            return cls.from_nodes_couples(nodes_couples, shape_by_patch), nodes_couples
 212        else:
 213            return cls.from_nodes_couples(nodes_couples, shape_by_patch)
 214
 215    def unpack(self, unique_field):
 216        """
 217        Extract the unpacked representation from a unique representation.
 218
 219        Parameters
 220        ----------
 221        unique_field : np.ndarray
 222            The unique representation. Its shape should be :
 223            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_unique_nodes`)
 224
 225        Returns
 226        -------
 227        unpacked_field : np.ndarray
 228            The unpacked representation. Its shape is :
 229            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_nodes`)
 230        """
 231        unpacked_field = unique_field[..., self.unique_nodes_inds]
 232        return unpacked_field
 233
 234    def pack(self, unpacked_field, method="mean"):
 235        """
 236        Extract the unique representation from an unpacked representation.
 237
 238        Parameters
 239        ----------
 240        unpacked_field : np.ndarray
 241            The unpacked representation. Its shape should be :
 242            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_nodes`)
 243        method: str
 244            The method used to group values that could be different
 245
 246        Returns
 247        -------
 248        unique_nodes : np.ndarray
 249            The unique representation. Its shape is :
 250            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_unique_nodes`)
 251        """
 252        field_shape = unpacked_field.shape[:-1]
 253        unique_field = np.zeros(
 254            (*field_shape, self.nb_unique_nodes), dtype=unpacked_field.dtype
 255        )
 256        if method == "last":
 257            unique_field[..., self.unique_nodes_inds] = unpacked_field
 258        elif method == "first":
 259            unique_field[..., self.unique_nodes_inds[::-1]] = unpacked_field[..., ::-1]
 260        elif method == "mean":
 261            np.add.at(unique_field.T, self.unique_nodes_inds, unpacked_field.T)
 262            counts = np.zeros(self.nb_unique_nodes, dtype="uint")
 263            np.add.at(counts, self.unique_nodes_inds, 1)
 264            unique_field /= counts
 265        else:
 266            raise NotImplementedError(
 267                f"Method {method} is not implemented ! Consider using 'first' or 'mean'."
 268            )
 269        return unique_field
 270
 271    def separate(self, unpacked_field):
 272        """
 273        Extract the separated representation from an unpacked representation.
 274
 275        Parameters
 276        ----------
 277        unpacked_field : np.ndarray
 278            The unpacked representation. Its shape is :
 279            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_nodes`)
 280
 281        Returns
 282        -------
 283        separated_field : list of np.ndarray
 284            The separated representation. Every array is of shape :
 285            (field, shape, ..., nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim `npa`)
 286        """
 287        field_shape = unpacked_field.shape[:-1]
 288        separated_field = []
 289        ind = 0
 290        for patch_shape in self.shape_by_patch:
 291            next_ind = ind + np.prod(patch_shape)
 292            separated_field.append(
 293                unpacked_field[..., ind:next_ind].reshape((*field_shape, *patch_shape))
 294            )
 295            ind = next_ind
 296        return separated_field
 297
 298    def agglomerate(self, separated_field):
 299        """
 300        Extract the unpacked representation from a separated representation.
 301
 302        Parameters
 303        ----------
 304        separated_field : list of np.ndarray
 305            The separated representation. Every array is of shape :
 306            (field, shape, ..., nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim `npa`)
 307
 308        Returns
 309        -------
 310        unpacked_field : np.ndarray
 311            The unpacked representation. Its shape is :
 312            (field, shape, ..., `self`.`nb_nodes`)
 313        """
 314        field_shape = separated_field[0].shape[: -self.npa]
 315        assert np.all(
 316            [f.shape[: -self.npa] == field_shape for f in separated_field]
 317        ), "Every patch must have the same field shape !"
 318        unpacked_field = np.concatenate(
 319            [f.reshape((*field_shape, -1)) for f in separated_field], axis=-1
 320        )
 321        return unpacked_field
 322
 323    def unique_field_indices(self, field_shape, representation="separated"):
 324        """
 325        Get the unique, unpacked or separated representation of a field's unique indices.
 326
 327        Parameters
 328        ----------
 329        field_shape : tuple of int
 330            The shape of the field. For example, if it is a vector field, `field_shape`
 331            should be (3,). If it is a second order tensor field, it should be (3, 3).
 332        representation : str, optional
 333            The user must choose between `"unique"`, `"unpacked"`, and `"separated"`.
 334            It corresponds to the type of representation to get, by default "separated"
 335
 336        Returns
 337        -------
 338        unique_field_indices : np.ndarray[np.integer] or list of np.ndarray[np.integer]
 339            The unique, unpacked or separated representation of a field's unique indices.
 340            If unique, its shape is (*`field_shape`, `self`.`nb_unique_nodes`).
 341            If unpacked, its shape is : (*`field_shape`, `self`.`nb_nodes`).
 342            If separated, every array is of shape : (*`field_shape`, nb elem for dim 1, ..., nb elem for dim `npa`).
 343        """
 344        nb_indices = np.prod(field_shape) * self.nb_unique_nodes
 345        unique_field_indices_as_unique_field = np.arange(
 346            nb_indices, dtype="int"
 347        ).reshape((*field_shape, self.nb_unique_nodes))
 348        if representation == "unique":
 349            unique_field_indices = unique_field_indices_as_unique_field
 350            return unique_field_indices
 351        elif representation == "unpacked":
 352            unique_field_indices = self.unpack(unique_field_indices_as_unique_field)
 353            return unique_field_indices
 354        elif representation == "separated":
 355            unique_field_indices = self.separate(
 356                self.unpack(unique_field_indices_as_unique_field)
 357            )
 358            return unique_field_indices
 359        else:
 360            raise ValueError(
 361                f'Representation "{representation}" not recognised. Representation must either be "unique", "unpacked", or "separated" !'
 362            )
 363
 364    def get_duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask(self):
 365        """
 366        Returns a boolean mask indicating which nodes in the unpacked representation are duplicates.
 367
 368        Returns
 369        -------
 370        duplicate_nodes_mask : np.ndarray
 371            Boolean mask of shape (nb_nodes,) where True indicates a node is duplicated
 372            across multiple patches and False indicates it appears only once.
 373        """
 374        _, inverse, counts = np.unique(
 375            self.unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True, return_counts=True
 376        )
 377        duplicate_nodes_mask = counts[inverse] > 1
 378        return duplicate_nodes_mask
 379
 380    def extract_exterior_borders(self, splines):
 381        """
 382        Extract exterior borders from B-spline patches.
 383
 384        Parameters
 385        ----------
 386        splines : list[BSpline]
 387            Array of B-spline patches to extract borders from.
 388
 389        Returns
 390        -------
 391        border_connectivity : MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
 392            Connectivity information for the border patches.
 393        border_splines : list[BSpline]
 394            Array of B-spline patches representing the borders.
 395        border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity : np.ndarray[np.integer]
 396            Array mapping border unique nodes to original unique nodes.
 397
 398        Raises
 399        ------
 400        AssertionError
 401            If isoparametric space dimension is less than 2.
 402        """
 403        if self.npa <= 1:
 404            raise AssertionError(
 405                "The parametric space must be at least 2D to extract borders !"
 406            )
 407        duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask = self.get_duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask()
 408        duplicate_separated_nodes_mask = self.separate(duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask)
 409        separated_unique_nodes_inds = self.unique_field_indices(())
 410        arr = np.arange(self.npa).tolist()
 411        border_splines = []
 412        border_unique_nodes_inds = []
 413        border_shape_by_patch = []
 414        for i in range(self.nb_patchs):
 415            spline = splines[i]
 416            duplicate_nodes_mask_spline = duplicate_separated_nodes_mask[i]
 417            unique_nodes_inds_spline = separated_unique_nodes_inds[i]
 418            shape_by_patch_spline = self.shape_by_patch[i]
 419            for axis in range(self.npa):
 420                bases = np.hstack((spline.bases[(axis + 1) :], spline.bases[:axis]))
 421                axes = arr[axis:-1] + arr[:axis]
 422                border_shape_by_patch_spline = np.hstack(
 423                    (shape_by_patch_spline[(axis + 1) :], shape_by_patch_spline[:axis])
 424                )
 425                if not np.take(duplicate_nodes_mask_spline, 0, axis=axis).all():
 426                    bspline_border = BSpline.from_bases(bases[::-1])
 427                    border_splines.append(bspline_border)
 428                    unique_nodes_inds_spline_border = (
 429                        np.take(unique_nodes_inds_spline, 0, axis=axis)
 430                        .transpose(axes[::-1])
 431                        .ravel()
 432                    )
 433                    border_unique_nodes_inds.append(unique_nodes_inds_spline_border)
 434                    border_shape_by_patch_spline_border = border_shape_by_patch_spline[
 435                        ::-1
 436                    ][None]
 437                    border_shape_by_patch.append(border_shape_by_patch_spline_border)
 438                    # print(f"side {0} of axis {axis} of patch {i} uses nodes {unique_nodes_inds_spline_border}")
 439                if not np.take(duplicate_nodes_mask_spline, -1, axis=axis).all():
 440                    bspline_border = BSpline.from_bases(bases)
 441                    border_splines.append(bspline_border)
 442                    unique_nodes_inds_spline_border = (
 443                        np.take(unique_nodes_inds_spline, -1, axis=axis)
 444                        .transpose(axes)
 445                        .ravel()
 446                    )
 447                    border_unique_nodes_inds.append(unique_nodes_inds_spline_border)
 448                    border_shape_by_patch_spline_border = border_shape_by_patch_spline[
 449                        None
 450                    ]
 451                    border_shape_by_patch.append(border_shape_by_patch_spline_border)
 452                    # print(f"side {-1} of axis {axis} of patch {i} uses nodes {unique_nodes_inds_spline_border}")
 453        border_splines = np.array(border_splines, dtype="object")
 454        border_unique_nodes_inds = np.concatenate(border_unique_nodes_inds)
 455        border_shape_by_patch = np.concatenate(border_shape_by_patch)
 456        border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity, inverse = np.unique(
 457            border_unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True
 458        )
 459        border_unique_nodes_inds -= np.cumsum(
 460            np.diff(np.concatenate(([-1], border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity)))
 461            - 1
 462        )[inverse]
 463        border_nb_unique_nodes = np.unique(border_unique_nodes_inds).size
 464        border_connectivity = self.__class__(
 465            border_unique_nodes_inds, border_shape_by_patch, border_nb_unique_nodes
 466        )
 467        return (
 468            border_connectivity,
 469            border_splines,
 470            border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity,
 471        )
 472
 473    def extract_interior_borders(self, splines):
 474        """
 475        Extract interior borders from B-spline patches where nodes are shared between patches.
 476
 477        Parameters
 478        ----------
 479        splines : list[BSpline]
 480            Array of B-spline patches to extract borders from.
 481
 482        Returns
 483        -------
 484        border_connectivity : MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
 485            Connectivity information for the border patches.
 486        border_splines : list[BSpline]
 487            Array of B-spline patches representing the borders.
 488        border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity : np.ndarray[np.integer]
 489            Array mapping border unique nodes to original unique nodes.
 490
 491        Raises
 492        ------
 493        AssertionError
 494            If parametric space dimension is less than 2.
 495        """
 496        if self.npa <= 1:
 497            raise AssertionError(
 498                "The parametric space must be at least 2D to extract borders !"
 499            )
 500        duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask = self.get_duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask()
 501        duplicate_separated_nodes_mask = self.separate(duplicate_unpacked_nodes_mask)
 502        separated_unique_nodes_inds = self.unique_field_indices(())
 503        arr = np.arange(self.npa).tolist()
 504        border_splines = []
 505        border_unique_nodes_inds = []
 506        border_shape_by_patch = []
 507        for i in range(self.nb_patchs):
 508            spline = splines[i]
 509            duplicate_nodes_mask_spline = duplicate_separated_nodes_mask[i]
 510            unique_nodes_inds_spline = separated_unique_nodes_inds[i]
 511            shape_by_patch_spline = self.shape_by_patch[i]
 512            for axis in range(self.npa):
 513                bases = np.hstack((spline.bases[(axis + 1) :], spline.bases[:axis]))
 514                axes = arr[axis:-1] + arr[:axis]
 515                border_shape_by_patch_spline = np.hstack(
 516                    (shape_by_patch_spline[(axis + 1) :], shape_by_patch_spline[:axis])
 517                )
 518                if np.take(duplicate_nodes_mask_spline, 0, axis=axis).all():
 519                    bspline_border = BSpline.from_bases(bases[::-1])
 520                    border_splines.append(bspline_border)
 521                    unique_nodes_inds_spline_border = (
 522                        np.take(unique_nodes_inds_spline, 0, axis=axis)
 523                        .transpose(axes[::-1])
 524                        .ravel()
 525                    )
 526                    border_unique_nodes_inds.append(unique_nodes_inds_spline_border)
 527                    border_shape_by_patch_spline_border = border_shape_by_patch_spline[
 528                        ::-1
 529                    ][None]
 530                    border_shape_by_patch.append(border_shape_by_patch_spline_border)
 531                    # print(f"side {0} of axis {axis} of patch {i} uses nodes {unique_nodes_inds_spline_border}")
 532                if np.take(duplicate_nodes_mask_spline, -1, axis=axis).all():
 533                    bspline_border = BSpline.from_bases(bases)
 534                    border_splines.append(bspline_border)
 535                    unique_nodes_inds_spline_border = (
 536                        np.take(unique_nodes_inds_spline, -1, axis=axis)
 537                        .transpose(axes)
 538                        .ravel()
 539                    )
 540                    border_unique_nodes_inds.append(unique_nodes_inds_spline_border)
 541                    border_shape_by_patch_spline_border = border_shape_by_patch_spline[
 542                        None
 543                    ]
 544                    border_shape_by_patch.append(border_shape_by_patch_spline_border)
 545                    # print(f"side {-1} of axis {axis} of patch {i} uses nodes {unique_nodes_inds_spline_border}")
 546        border_splines = np.array(border_splines, dtype="object")
 547        border_unique_nodes_inds = np.concatenate(border_unique_nodes_inds)
 548        border_shape_by_patch = np.concatenate(border_shape_by_patch)
 549        border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity, inverse = np.unique(
 550            border_unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True
 551        )
 552        border_unique_nodes_inds -= np.cumsum(
 553            np.diff(np.concatenate(([-1], border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity)))
 554            - 1
 555        )[inverse]
 556        border_nb_unique_nodes = np.unique(border_unique_nodes_inds).size
 557        border_connectivity = self.__class__(
 558            border_unique_nodes_inds, border_shape_by_patch, border_nb_unique_nodes
 559        )
 560        return (
 561            border_connectivity,
 562            border_splines,
 563            border_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity,
 564        )
 565

 645    def subset(self, splines, patches_to_keep):
 646        """
 647        Create a subset of the multi-patch B-spline connectivity by keeping only selected patches.
 648
 649        Parameters
 650        ----------
 651        splines : list[BSpline]
 652            Array of B-spline patches to subset.
 653        patches_to_keep : np.ndarray[np.integer]
 654            Indices of patches to keep in the subset.
 655
 656        Returns
 657        -------
 658        new_connectivity : MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
 659            New connectivity object containing only the selected patches.
 660        new_splines : list[BSpline]
 661            Array of B-spline patches for the selected patches.
 662        new_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity : np.ndarray[np.integer]
 663            Array mapping new unique nodes to original unique nodes.
 664        """
 665        new_splines = splines[patches_to_keep]
 666        separated_unique_nodes_inds = self.unique_field_indices(())
 667        new_unique_nodes_inds = np.concatenate(
 668            [separated_unique_nodes_inds[patch].flat for patch in patches_to_keep]
 669        )
 670        new_shape_by_patch = self.shape_by_patch[patches_to_keep]
 671        new_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity, inverse = np.unique(
 672            new_unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True
 673        )
 674        new_unique_nodes_inds -= np.cumsum(
 675            np.diff(np.concatenate(([-1], new_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity))) - 1
 676        )[inverse]
 677        new_nb_unique_nodes = np.unique(new_unique_nodes_inds).size
 678        new_connectivity = self.__class__(
 679            new_unique_nodes_inds, new_shape_by_patch, new_nb_unique_nodes
 680        )
 681        return new_connectivity, new_splines, new_unique_to_self_unique_connectivity
 682
 683    def make_control_poly_meshes(
 684        self,
 685        splines: Iterable[BSpline],
 686        separated_ctrl_pts: Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]],
 687        n_eval_per_elem: Union[Iterable[int], int] = 10,
 688        n_step: int = 1,
 689        unique_fields: dict = {},
 690        separated_fields: Union[dict, None] = None,
 691        XI_list: Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]] = None,
 692        paraview_sizes: dict = {},
 693    ) -> list[io.Mesh]:
 694
 695        if type(n_eval_per_elem) is int:
 696            n_eval_per_elem = [n_eval_per_elem] * self.npa
 697
 698        if separated_fields is None:
 699            separated_fields = [{} for _ in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 700
 701        if XI_list is None:
 702            XI_list = [None] * self.nb_patchs
 703
 704        for key, value in unique_fields.items():
 705            if callable(value):
 706                raise NotImplementedError(
 707                    "To handle functions as fields, use separated_fields !"
 708                )
 709            else:
 710                if value.shape[-1] != self.nb_unique_nodes:
 711                    raise ValueError(
 712                        f"Field {key} of unique_fields is in a wrong format (not unique format)."
 713                    )
 714                separated_value = self.separate(self.unpack(value))
 715                for patch in range(self.nb_patchs):
 716                    separated_fields[patch][key] = separated_value[patch]
 717
 718        step_meshes = np.empty((self.nb_patchs, n_step), dtype=object)
 719        for patch in range(self.nb_patchs):
 720            step_meshes[patch] = splines[patch].make_control_poly_meshes(
 721                separated_ctrl_pts[patch],
 722                n_eval_per_elem=n_eval_per_elem,
 723                n_step=n_step,
 724                fields=separated_fields[patch],
 725                XI=XI_list[patch],
 726                paraview_sizes=paraview_sizes,
 727            )
 728            for mesh in step_meshes[patch]:
 729                mesh.point_data["patch_id"] = np.full(
 730                    mesh.points.shape[0], patch, dtype=int
 731                )
 732        meshes = []
 733        for time_step_meshes in step_meshes.T:
 734            meshes.append(merge_meshes(time_step_meshes))
 735        return meshes
 736
 737    def make_elem_separator_meshes(
 738        self,
 739        splines: Iterable[BSpline],
 740        separated_ctrl_pts: Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]],
 741        n_eval_per_elem: Union[Iterable[int], int] = 10,
 742        n_step: int = 1,
 743        unique_fields: dict = {},
 744        separated_fields: Union[dict, None] = None,
 745        XI_list: Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]] = None,
 746        paraview_sizes: dict = {},
 747        parallel: bool = True,
 748        verbose: bool = True,
 749    ) -> list[io.Mesh]:
 750
 751        if type(n_eval_per_elem) is int:
 752            n_eval_per_elem = [n_eval_per_elem] * self.npa
 753
 754        if separated_fields is None:
 755            separated_fields = [{} for _ in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 756
 757        if XI_list is None:
 758            XI_list = [None] * self.nb_patchs
 759
 760        for key, value in unique_fields.items():
 761            if callable(value):
 762                raise NotImplementedError(
 763                    "To handle functions as fields, use separated_fields !"
 764                )
 765            else:
 766                if value.shape[-1] != self.nb_unique_nodes:
 767                    raise ValueError(
 768                        f"Field {key} of unique_fields is in a wrong format (not unique format)."
 769                    )
 770                separated_value = self.separate(self.unpack(value))
 771                for patch in range(self.nb_patchs):
 772                    separated_fields[patch][key] = separated_value[patch]
 773
 774        funcs = [splines[i].make_elem_separator_meshes for i in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 775        all_args = [
 776            (
 777                separated_ctrl_pts[i],
 778                n_eval_per_elem,
 779                n_step,
 780                separated_fields[i],
 781                XI_list[i],
 782                paraview_sizes,
 783            )
 784            for i in range(self.nb_patchs)
 785        ]
 786
 787        elem_separator_meshes = parallel_blocks(
 788            funcs,
 789            all_args,
 790            verbose=verbose,
 791            pbar_title="Making elements separators meshes",
 792            disable_parallel=not parallel,
 793        )
 794
 795        for patch, step_meshes in enumerate(elem_separator_meshes):
 796            for timestep, mesh in enumerate(step_meshes):
 797                mesh.point_data["patch_id"] = np.full(
 798                    mesh.points.shape[0], patch, dtype=int
 799                )
 800        meshes = []
 801        for timestep, patch_meshes in enumerate(zip(*elem_separator_meshes)):
 802            meshes.append(merge_meshes(patch_meshes))
 803
 804        return meshes
 805
 806    def make_elements_interior_meshes(
 807        self,
 808        splines: Iterable[BSpline],
 809        separated_ctrl_pts: Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]],
 810        n_eval_per_elem: Union[Iterable[int], int] = 10,
 811        n_step: int = 1,
 812        unique_fields: dict = {},
 813        separated_fields: Union[dict, None] = None,
 814        XI_list: Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]] = None,
 815        parallel: bool = True,
 816        verbose: bool = True,
 817    ) -> list[io.Mesh]:
 818        if type(n_eval_per_elem) is int:
 819            n_eval_per_elem = [n_eval_per_elem] * self.npa
 820
 821        if separated_fields is None:
 822            separated_fields = [{} for _ in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 823
 824        if XI_list is None:
 825            XI_list = [None] * self.nb_patchs
 826
 827        for key, value in unique_fields.items():
 828            if callable(value):
 829                raise NotImplementedError(
 830                    "To handle functions as fields, use separated_fields !"
 831                )
 832            else:
 833                if value.shape[-1] != self.nb_unique_nodes:
 834                    raise ValueError(
 835                        f"Field {key} of unique_fields is in a wrong format (not unique format)."
 836                    )
 837                separated_value = self.separate(self.unpack(value))
 838                for patch in range(self.nb_patchs):
 839                    separated_fields[patch][key] = separated_value[patch]
 840
 841        funcs = [
 842            splines[i].make_elements_interior_meshes for i in range(self.nb_patchs)
 843        ]
 844        all_args = [
 845            (
 846                separated_ctrl_pts[i],
 847                n_eval_per_elem,
 848                n_step,
 849                separated_fields[i],
 850                XI_list[i],
 851            )
 852            for i in range(self.nb_patchs)
 853        ]
 854
 855        interior_meshes = parallel_blocks(
 856            funcs,
 857            all_args,
 858            verbose=verbose,
 859            pbar_title="Making interior meshes",
 860            disable_parallel=not parallel,
 861        )
 862
 863        for patch, step_meshes in enumerate(interior_meshes):
 864            for timestep, mesh in enumerate(step_meshes):
 865                mesh.point_data["patch_id"] = np.full(
 866                    mesh.points.shape[0], patch, dtype=int
 867                )
 868        meshes = []
 869        for timestep, patch_meshes in enumerate(zip(*interior_meshes)):
 870            meshes.append(merge_meshes(patch_meshes))
 871
 872        return meshes
 873
 874    def make_all_meshes(
 875        self,
 876        splines: Iterable[BSpline],
 877        separated_ctrl_pts: Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]],
 878        n_step: int = 1,
 879        n_eval_per_elem: Union[int, Iterable[int]] = 10,
 880        unique_fields: dict = {},
 881        separated_fields: Union[list[dict], None] = None,
 882        XI_list: Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]] = None,
 883        verbose: bool = True,
 884        fields_on_interior_only: Union[bool, Literal["auto"], list[str]] = "auto",
 885        disable_parallel: bool = False,
 886    ) -> tuple[list[io.Mesh], list[io.Mesh], list[io.Mesh]]:
 887        """
 888        Generate all mesh representations (interior, element borders, and control points) for a multipatch B-spline geometry.
 889
 890        This method creates three types of meshes for visualization or analysis:
 891        - The interior mesh representing the B-spline surface or volume.
 892        - The element separator mesh showing the borders between elements.
 893        - The control polygon mesh showing the control structure.
 894
 895        Parameters
 896        ----------
 897        splines : Iterable[BSpline]
 898            List of B-spline patches to process.
 899        separated_ctrl_pts : Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]]
 900            Control points for each patch in separated representation.
 901        n_step : int, optional
 902            Number of time steps to generate. By default, 1.
 903        n_eval_per_elem : Union[int, Iterable[int]], optional
 904            Number of evaluation points per element for each isoparametric dimension.
 905            If an `int` is provided, the same number is used for all dimensions.
 906            If an `Iterable` is provided, each value corresponds to a different dimension.
 907            By default, 10.
 908        unique_fields : dict, optional
 909            Fields in unique representation to visualize. By default, `{}`.
 910            Keys are field names, values are arrays (not callables nor FE fields).
 911        separated_fields : Union[list[dict], None], optional
 912            Fields to visualize at each time step.
 913            List of `self.nb_patchs` dictionaries (one per patch) of format:
 914            {
 915                "field_name": `field_value`
 916            }
 917            where `field_value` can be either:
 918            1. A `np.ndarray` with shape (`n_step`, `field_size`, `self.shape_by_patch[patch]`)
 919            2. A `np.ndarray` with shape (`n_step`, `field_size`, `*grid_shape`)
 920            3. A function that computes field values (`np.ndarray[np.floating]`) at given points from the `BSpline` instance and `XI`.
 921            By default, None.
 922        XI_list : Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]], optional
 923            Parametric coordinates at which to evaluate the B-spline patches and fields.
 924            If not `None`, overrides the `n_eval_per_elem` parameter.
 925            If `None`, regular grids are generated according to `n_eval_per_elem`.
 926            By default, None.
 927        verbose : bool, optional
 928            Whether to print progress information. By default, True.
 929        fiels_on_interior_only: Union[bool, Literal['auto'], list[str]], optionnal
 930            Whether to include fields only on the interior mesh (`True`), on all meshes (`False`),
 931            or on specified field names.
 932            If set to `'auto'`, fields named `'u'`, `'U'`, `'displacement'` or `'displ'`
 933            are included on all meshes while others are only included on the interior mesh.
 934            By default, 'auto'.
 935        disable_parallel : bool, optional
 936            Wether to disable parallel execution. By default, False.
 937
 938        Returns
 939        -------
 940        tuple[list[io.Mesh], list[io.Mesh], list[io.Mesh]]
 941            Tuple containing three lists of `io.Mesh` objects:
 942            - Interior meshes for each time step.
 943            - Element separator meshes for each time step.
 944            - Control polygon meshes for each time step.
 945
 946        Raises
 947        ------
 948        NotImplementedError
 949            If a callable is passed in `unique_fields`.
 950        ValueError
 951            If a field in `unique_fields` does not have the correct shape.
 952
 953        Notes
 954        -----
 955        - The isoparametric space refers to the parametric space of the B-splines.
 956        - Fields can be visualized as scalars or vectors.
 957        - Supports time-dependent visualization through `n_step`.
 958        - Fields in `unique_fields` must be arrays; to use callables, use `separated_fields`.
 959
 960        Examples
 961        --------
 962        >>> interior, borders, control = connectivity.make_all_meshes(splines, separated_ctrl_pts)
 963        """
 964
 965        if type(n_eval_per_elem) is int:
 966            n_eval_per_elem = [n_eval_per_elem] * self.npa
 967
 968        if separated_fields is None:
 969            separated_fields = [{} for _ in range(self.nb_patchs)]
 970
 971        if XI_list is None:
 972            XI_list = [None] * self.nb_patchs
 973
 974        for key, value in unique_fields.items():
 975            if callable(value):
 976                raise NotImplementedError(
 977                    "To handle functions as fields, use separated_fields !"
 978                )
 979            else:
 980                if value.shape[-1] != self.nb_unique_nodes:
 981                    raise ValueError(
 982                        f"Field {key} of unique_fields is in a wrong format (not unique format)."
 983                    )
 984                separated_value = self.separate(self.unpack(value))
 985                for patch in range(self.nb_patchs):
 986                    separated_fields[patch][key] = separated_value[patch]
 987
 988        paraview_sizes = {}
 989        fields = separated_fields[0]
 990        if fields_on_interior_only is True:
 991            for key, value in fields.items():
 992                if callable(value):
 993                    paraview_sizes[key] = value(
 994                        splines[0], np.zeros((splines[0].NPa, 1))
 995                    ).shape[2]
 996                else:
 997                    paraview_sizes[key] = value.shape[1]
 998        elif fields_on_interior_only is False:
 999            pass
1000        elif fields_on_interior_only == "auto":
1001            for key, value in fields.items():
1002                if key not in ["u", "U", "displacement", "displ"]:
1003                    if callable(value):
1004                        paraview_sizes[key] = value(
1005                            splines[0], np.zeros((splines[0].NPa, 1))
1006                        ).shape[2]
1007                    else:
1008                        paraview_sizes[key] = value.shape[1]
1009        else:
1010            for key in fields_on_interior_only:
1011                value = fields[key]
1012                if callable(value):
1013                    paraview_sizes[key] = value(
1014                        splines[0], np.zeros((splines[0].NPa, 1))
1015                    ).shape[2]
1016                else:
1017                    paraview_sizes[key] = value.shape[1]
1018
1019        elem_interior_meshes = self.make_elements_interior_meshes(
1020            splines,
1021            separated_ctrl_pts,
1022            n_eval_per_elem,
1023            n_step,
1024            separated_fields=separated_fields,
1025            XI_list=XI_list,
1026            verbose=verbose,
1027            parallel=(not disable_parallel),
1028        )
1029        if verbose:
1030            print("interior done")
1031
1032        elem_separator_meshes = self.make_elem_separator_meshes(
1033            splines,
1034            separated_ctrl_pts,
1035            n_eval_per_elem,
1036            n_step,
1037            separated_fields=separated_fields,
1038            XI_list=XI_list,
1039            paraview_sizes=paraview_sizes,
1040            parallel=(not disable_parallel),
1041        )
1042        if verbose:
1043            print("elements borders done")
1044
1045        control_poly_meshes = self.make_control_poly_meshes(
1046            splines,
1047            separated_ctrl_pts,
1048            n_eval_per_elem,
1049            n_step,
1050            separated_fields=separated_fields,
1051            XI_list=XI_list,
1052            paraview_sizes=paraview_sizes,
1053        )
1054        if verbose:
1055            print("control points done")
1056
1057        return elem_interior_meshes, elem_separator_meshes, control_poly_meshes
1058
1059    def save_paraview(
1060        self,
1061        splines: Iterable[BSpline],
1062        separated_ctrl_pts: Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]],
1063        path: str,
1064        name: str,
1065        n_step: int = 1,
1066        n_eval_per_elem: Union[int, Iterable[int]] = 10,
1067        unique_fields: dict = {},
1068        separated_fields: Union[list[dict], None] = None,
1069        XI_list: Union[None, Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]]] = None,
1070        groups: Union[dict[str, dict[str, Union[str, int]]], None] = None,
1071        make_pvd: bool = True,
1072        verbose: bool = True,
1073        fields_on_interior_only: Union[bool, Literal["auto"], list[str]] = "auto",
1074        disable_parallel: bool = False,
1075    ):
1076        """
1077        Save multipatch B-spline visualization data as Paraview files.
1078
1079        This method generates three types of visualization files for a multipatch B-spline geometry:
1080        - Interior mesh showing the B-spline surface/volume
1081        - Element borders showing the mesh structure
1082        - Control points mesh showing the control structure
1083
1084        All files are saved in VTU format, with an optional PVD file to group them for Paraview.
1085
1086        Parameters
1087        ----------
1088        splines : Iterable[BSpline]
1089            List of B-spline patches to save.
1090        separated_ctrl_pts : Iterable[np.ndarray[np.floating]]
1091            Control points for each patch in separated representation.
1092        path : str
1093            Directory path where the files will be saved.
1094        name : str
1095            Base name for the output files.
1096        n_step : int, optional
1097            Number of time steps to save. By default, 1.
1098        n_eval_per_elem : Union[int, Iterable[int]], optional
1099            Number of evaluation points per element for each isoparametric dimension.
1100            If an `int` is provided, the same number is used for all dimensions.
1101            If an `Iterable` is provided, each value corresponds to a different dimension.
1102            By default, 10.
1103        unique_fields : dict, optional
1104            Fields in unique representation to save. By default, `{}`.
1105            Keys are field names, values are arrays (not callables nor FE fields).
1106        separated_fields : Union[list[dict], None], optional
1107            Fields to visualize at each time step.
1108            List of `self.nb_patchs` dictionaries (one per patch) of format:
1109            {
1110                "field_name": `field_value`
1111            }
1112            where `field_value` can be either:
1113
1114            1. A numpy array with shape (`n_step`, `field_size`, `self.shape_by_patch[patch]`) where:
1115            - `n_step`: Number of time steps
1116            - `field_size`: Size of the field at each point (1 for scalar, 3 for vector)
1117            - `self.shape_by_patch[patch]`: Same shape as the patch's control points grid (excluding `NPh`)
1118
1119            2. A numpy array with shape (`n_step`, `field_size`, `*grid_shape`) where:
1120            - `n_step`: Number of time steps
1121            - `field_size`: Size of the field at each point (1 for scalar, 3 for vector)
1122            - `*grid_shape`: Shape of the evaluation grid (number of points along each isoparametric axis)
1123
1124            3. A function that computes field values (`np.ndarray[np.floating]`) at given
1125            points from the `BSpline` instance and `XI`, the tuple of arrays containing evaluation
1126            points for each dimension (`tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]`).
1127            The result should be an array of shape (`n_step`, `n_points`, `field_size`) where:
1128            - `n_step`: Number of time steps
1129            - `n_points`: Number of evaluation points (n_xi  n_eta  ...)
1130            - `field_size`: Size of the field at each point (1 for scalar, 3 for vector)
1131
1132            By default, None.
1133        XI_list : Iterable[tuple[np.ndarray[np.floating], ...]], optional
1134            Parametric coordinates at which to evaluate the B-spline patches and fields.
1135            If not `None`, overrides the `n_eval_per_elem` parameter.
1136            If `None`, regular grids are generated according to `n_eval_per_elem`.
1137        groups : Union[dict[str, dict[str, Union[str, int]]], None], optional
1138            Nested dictionary specifying file groups for PVD organization. Format:
1139            {
1140                "group_name": {
1141                    "ext": str,     # File extension (e.g., "vtu")
1142                    "npart": int,   # Number of parts in the group
1143                    "nstep": int    # Number of timesteps
1144                }
1145            }
1146            If provided, existing groups are updated; if `None`, groups are created automatically.
1147            By default, `None`.
1148        make_pvd : bool, optional
1149            Whether to create a PVD file grouping all VTU files. By default, `True`.
1150        verbose : bool, optional
1151            Whether to print progress information. By default, `True`.
1152        fields_on_interior_only: Union[bool, Literal['auto'], list[str]], optionnal
1153            Whether to include fields only on the interior mesh (`True`), on all meshes (`False`),
1154            or on specified field names.
1155            If set to `'auto'`, fields named `'u'`, `'U'`, `'displacement'` or `'displ'`
1156            are included on all meshes while others are only included on the interior mesh.
1157            By default, 'auto'.
1158        disable_parallel : bool, optional
1159            Whether to disable the parallel execution. By default, False.
1160
1161        Returns
1162        -------
1163        groups : dict[str, dict[str, Union[str, int]]]
1164            Updated groups dictionary with information about saved files.
1165
1166        Raises
1167        ------
1168        NotImplementedError
1169            If a callable is passed in `unique_fields`.
1170        ValueError
1171            If the multiprocessing pool is not running and cannot be restarted.
1172
1173        Notes
1174        -----
1175        - Creates three types of VTU files for each time step:
1176            - {name}_interior_{part}_{step}.vtu
1177            - {name}_elements_borders_{part}_{step}.vtu
1178            - {name}_control_points_{part}_{step}.vtu
1179        - If `make_pvd=True`, creates a PVD file named {name}.pvd.
1180        - Fields can be visualized as scalars or vectors in Paraview.
1181        - The method supports time-dependent visualization through `n_step`.
1182        - Fields in `unique_fields` must be arrays; to use callables, use `separated_fields`.
1183
1184        Examples
1185        --------
1186        Save a multipatch B-spline visualization:
1187        >>> connectivity.save_paraview(splines, separated_ctrl_pts, "./output", "multipatch")
1188
1189        Save with a custom separated field on a 2 patches multipatch:
1190        >>> fields = [{"temperature": np.random.rand(1, 4, 4)}, {"temperature": np.random.rand(1, 7, 3)}]
1191        >>> connectivity.save_paraview(splines, separated_ctrl_pts, "./output", "multipatch", separated_fields=fields)
1192        """
1193
1194        if groups is None:
1195            groups = {}
1196
1197        interior = "interior"
1198        if interior in groups:
1199            groups[interior]["npart"] += 1
1200        else:
1201            groups[interior] = {"ext": "vtu", "npart": 1, "nstep": n_step}
1202        elements_borders = "elements_borders"
1203        if elements_borders in groups:
1204            groups[elements_borders]["npart"] += 1
1205        else:
1206            groups[elements_borders] = {"ext": "vtu", "npart": 1, "nstep": n_step}
1207        control_points = "control_points"
1208        if control_points in groups:
1209            groups[control_points]["npart"] += 1
1210        else:
1211            groups[control_points] = {"ext": "vtu", "npart": 1, "nstep": n_step}
1212
1213        elem_interior_meshes, elem_separator_meshes, control_poly_meshes = (
1214            self.make_all_meshes(
1215                splines,
1216                separated_ctrl_pts,
1217                n_step,
1218                n_eval_per_elem,
1219                unique_fields,
1220                separated_fields,
1221                XI_list,
1222                verbose,
1223                fields_on_interior_only,
1224                disable_parallel=disable_parallel,
1225            )
1226        )
1227
1228        prefix = os.path.join(
1229            path, f"{name}_{interior}_{groups[interior]['npart'] - 1}"
1230        )
1231        for time_step, mesh in enumerate(elem_interior_meshes):
1232            mesh.write(f"{prefix}_{time_step}.vtu")
1233        if verbose:
1234            print(interior, "saved")
1235
1236        prefix = os.path.join(
1237            path, f"{name}_{elements_borders}_{groups[elements_borders]['npart'] - 1}"
1238        )
1239        for time_step, mesh in enumerate(elem_separator_meshes):
1240            mesh.write(f"{prefix}_{time_step}.vtu")
1241        if verbose:
1242            print(elements_borders, "saved")
1243
1244        prefix = os.path.join(
1245            path, f"{name}_{control_points}_{groups[control_points]['npart'] - 1}"
1246        )
1247        for time_step, mesh in enumerate(control_poly_meshes):
1248            mesh.write(f"{prefix}_{time_step}.vtu")
1249        if verbose:
1250            print(control_points, "saved")
1251
1252        if make_pvd:
1253            writePVD(os.path.join(path, name), groups)
1254
1255        return groups

Contains all the methods to link multiple B-spline patches. It uses 3 representations of the data :

  • a unique representation, possibly common with other meshes, containing only unique nodes indices,
  • a unpacked representation containing duplicated nodes indices,
  • a separated representation containing duplicated nodes indices, separated between patches. It is here for user friendliness.
Attributes
  • unique_nodes_inds (np.ndarray[np.integer]): The indices of the unique representation needed to create the unpacked one.
  • shape_by_patch (np.ndarray[np.integer]): The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
  • nb_nodes (int): The total number of unpacked nodes.
  • nb_unique_nodes (int): The total number of unique nodes.
  • nb_patchs (int): The number of patches.
  • npa (int): The dimension of the parametric space of the B-splines.
MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity(unique_nodes_inds, shape_by_patch, nb_unique_nodes) 
 87    def __init__(self, unique_nodes_inds, shape_by_patch, nb_unique_nodes):
 88        """
 89
 90        Parameters
 91        ----------
 92        unique_nodes_inds : np.ndarray[np.integer]
 93            The indices of the unique representation needed to create the unpacked one.
 94        shape_by_patch : np.ndarray[np.integer]
 95            The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
 96        nb_unique_nodes : int
 97            The total number of unique nodes.
 98        """
 99        self.unique_nodes_inds = unique_nodes_inds
100        self.shape_by_patch = shape_by_patch
101        self.nb_nodes = np.sum(np.prod(self.shape_by_patch, axis=1))
102        self.nb_unique_nodes = nb_unique_nodes  # np.unique(self.unique_nodes_inds).size
103        self.nb_patchs, self.npa = self.shape_by_patch.shape

@classmethod
def from_nodes_couples(cls, nodes_couples, shape_by_patch): 
105    @classmethod
106    def from_nodes_couples(cls, nodes_couples, shape_by_patch):
107        """
108        Create the connectivity from a list of couples of unpacked nodes.
109
110        Parameters
111        ----------
112        nodes_couples : np.ndarray[np.integer]
113            Couples of indices of unpacked nodes that are considered the same.
114            Its shape should be (# of couples, 2)
115        shape_by_patch : np.ndarray[np.integer]
116            The shape of the separated nodes by patch.
117
118        Returns
119        -------
120        MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity
121            Instance of `MultiPatchBSplineConnectivity` created.
122        """
123        nb_nodes = np.sum(np.prod(shape_by_patch, axis=1))
124        unique_nodes_inds = _get_unique_nodes_inds(
125            nodes_couples.astype(np.int32), np.int64(nb_nodes)
126        )
127        different_unique_nodes_inds, inverse = np.unique(
128            unique_nodes_inds, return_inverse=True
129        )
130        unique_nodes_inds -= np.cumsum(
131            np.diff(np.concatenate(([-1], different_unique_nodes_inds))) - 1
132        )[inverse]
133        nb_unique_nodes = np.unique(unique_nodes_inds).size
134        return cls(unique_nodes_inds, shape_by_patch, nb_unique_nodes)
